sense.name: (cause to) move back and forth or side to side
sense.examples: The flagpole rocked in the gale-force winds. Slowly he rocked back and forth, back and forth. The waves rocked the small craft. Don't rock the boat!

sense.name: rouse to excitement
sense.examples: He rocked the house with hits like It's All Over, Love and Happiness. He rocked the IDS market with Dragon.

sense.name: shock or disturb
sense.examples: The girl's murder rocked the small community. Tan Sri Basir said heavy lending to the property sector rocked the bank when property prices in Malaysia plummeted in 1984-85.
